de.mrapp.android.adapter.datastructure

Interface Restorable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Adapter<AdapterViewType>, ExpandableGridViewAdapter, ExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, ExpandableRecyclerViewAdapter, ListAdapter<DataType>, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, MultipleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, NoChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, NoChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, RecyclerViewAdapter, SelectableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SelectableListAdapter<DataType>, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractEnableStateListAdapter, AbstractExpandableListAdapter, AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractFilterableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateListAdapter, AbstractListAdapter, AbstractSelectableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSelectableListAdapter, AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSortableListAdapter, ExpandableListAdapterImplementation, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation, MultipleChoiceListAdapterImplementation, NoChoiceListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation

    public interface Restorable
    Defines the interface, a class whose state should be able to be stored, before an activity is killed and restored after it has been reinitialized, must implement.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState, java.lang.String key)
      This method may be called to restore a previously saved state of the adapter after an activity has been reinitialized.
      void onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle outState, java.lang.String key)
      This method may be called to store the state of the adapter within a bundle.

    • Method Detail

      • onSaveInstanceState

        void onSaveInstanceState(@NonNull
                         android.os.Bundle outState,
                         @NonNull
                         java.lang.String key)
        This method may be called to store the state of the adapter within a bundle. For example, this method may be used to store the state of the adapter before an activity is destroyed in its onSaveInstanceState method.
        Parameters:
        outState - The bundle, which should be used to store the saved state, as an instance of the class Bundle. The bundle may not be null
        key - The key, which should be used to store the saved state, as a String. The string may neither be null, nor null

      • onRestoreInstanceState

        void onRestoreInstanceState(@NonNull
                            android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState,
                            @NonNull
                            java.lang.String key)
        This method may be called to restore a previously saved state of the adapter after an activity has been reinitialized. For example, this method may be used to restore the state of the adapter within an activity's onRestoreInstanceState method.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - The bundle, which contains the previously saved state, as an instance of the class Bundle. The bundle may be null
        key - The key, which previously has been used to store the saved state, as a String. The key may neither be null, nor null
